text: How are equivalent ratios useful in solving this problem?

Continue exploring ratios with a focus on finding and using equivalent ratios to solve problems.

Begin to notice, use, and articulate that

  • equivalent ratios are related by a common multiplicative factor;
  • equivalent ratios can be found by scaling up (multiplying)a given ratio or scaling down (dividing) from the given ratio; and
  • using ratio relationships to solve problems is referred to as reasoning with ratios and can be a quick and powerful tool for problem solving.

Some students may begin to notice that identifying a unit rate, 1:x or y:1, can be useful for solving problems with ratios. In Investigation 3, unit rates will become more explicit.
